title: [FEA] Fully support nested types in Spark SQL functions

labels.name: task
labels.description: Work required that improves the product but is not user facing

labels.name: epic
labels.description: Issue that encompasses a significant feature or body of work

body:
Since libcudf now has full support for nested types in both equality and lexicographic comparisons, we should also adopt such features to various Spark SQL functions in the plugin.

Currently, there are several existing FEA issues related to nested types that can be addressed:

| Feature | Issue(s) | PR(s) | Status | Notes |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Fully support nested type for HashPartitioning | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/8676 | | :x: | Top dependency for all other issues. |
| Verify that array nulls are empty | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/5430 | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/pull/8517 | :heavy_check_mark: | Top dependency for all other issues. |
| Order-by on arbitrary level nested arrays | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/5509, https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/7230 | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/pull/7233 | :x: | Depends on https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/5430. |
| Use merge sort for nested types | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/2252 | https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/pull/13347 | :x: | Depends on https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/5430 and cudf issues: https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/issues/8050 and https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/issues/13514. |
| Sort arrays containing nested types | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/3715 | | :x: | Depends on https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/5430. |
| Support hash aggregate on single-level arrays | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/6680 | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/pull/7465 | :heavy_check_mark: | |
| Support hash aggregate on nested arrays | N/A |  | :x: | Depends on https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/8676. |
| Support `min`/`max` in groupby/reduction for nested structs | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/3153, https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/issues/8974, https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/issues/8964 | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/pull/8638 | :heavy_check_mark:  | There is no support for windowing ops. |
| Support `min`/`max` in groupby/reduction for nested arrays | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/4929, https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/4900, https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/8668 | https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/pull/13069, https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/pull/13676, https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/pull/8689 | :x: | There is no support for windowing ops. |
| Support Delta Lake optimized write on Databricks | https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/7799 | | :x: | Require to implement GPU partitioning for nested types (https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/4887). Also depends on https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/5430 and https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/6680. |
